Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Level 2

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Mechanical Engineering Drawing and Documentation
Description: Description: Upon successful completion of this course, the student will be able to identify workpiece features, interpret and sketch revolved, removed, partial and broken out sectional views, describe geometric tolerancing. Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Applied Trade Practices and Procedures
Description: Description: The course provides the student with a practical application of heat treatment of ferrous metals, non ferrous metals, precision measurement of part dimensions and features, various turning operations, milling operations and grinding operations.

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Trade Theory
Description: Description: The course provides the student with a theoretical background of heat treatment of ferrous metals; non ferrous metals; precision measurement of part dimensions and features; turning operations; milling operations and grinding operations.

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Applied Mechanical Calculations
Description: Description: Upon successful completion of this course, the student will be able to recognize and use fundamental principles of geometric measurement to solve shop-related problems involving circles, tangents, triangles and polygons. In addition, the student will be able to solve trades-specific problems involving right triangle trigonometry. Hours: 30Credits: 2Pre-Requisites: CoRequisites:

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Trade Theory
Description: Description: This course provides the apprentice with a theoretical background to prepare feeder and conveyor components for assembly on to machine-tools and system installation; processes for preparing sub-assembly parts; fit and assemble of parts and sub-assemblies; testing and verifying functionality of sub-assemblies; the process for integrating main-assemblies and the dry-run testing process of a main-assembly.Hours: 102Credits: 7Pre-Requisites: CoRequisites:
